bug.summary: Cannot compile mlpack on Ubuntu 18.04 and below
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
Compiling the master branch of mlpack without libstb-dev gives the errors: <denchmark-code>In file included from /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/core/data/load.hpp:23:0, from /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/core/util/cli_impl.hpp:19, from /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/core/util/cli.hpp:329, from /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/core.hpp:72, from /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/bindings/tests/clean_memory.cpp:14: /home/favre49/mlpack/src/mlpack/core/data/image_info.hpp:29:10: fatal error: stb_image_write.h: No such file or directory #include <stb_image_write.h> </denchmark-code>
However, libstb-dev is only available for Ubuntu eoan and Ubuntu disco. Hence, it isn't possible for users with older versions to compile. This problem also exists for libensmallen-dev, but can be compiled from source. <denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of mlpack: master branch operating system: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS compiler: gcc 7.4.0 version of dependencies (Boost/Armadillo): Sufficient any other environment information you think is relevant:
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run make mlpack_test on a machine on Ubuntu 18.04 and below. <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Code compiles. <denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
Error specified

comments.comment: Interesting, I'm a bit surprised because if STB isn't found, then mlpack should automatically download it. Can you also provide the output of the CMake configuration step?

This problem also exists for libensmallen-dev, but can be compiled from source.
Do you mean it's not detected by CMake, as libensmallen doesn't depend or use stb.
Just tested cmake -DDOWNLOAD_STB_IMAGE=OFF .., which disables STB; haven't encountered any issue.
I tried it on my own machine. To solve it delete your current build directory. Make it once again and run cmake ../ once again. It will resolve everything.
Sorry for the late reply, been busy. Thanks for the suggestions, deleting the build file and starting over worked for me. Works as I had expected now.
Awesome, great to hear you got it worked out. üëç
